summary: This is an email exchange between FBI personnel regarding an application for continued presence for one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims. The email discusses obtaining a signature for the application and indicates the involvement of the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking
persons.context: Email sender from the FBI New York office who is handling a continued presence application for an Epstein victim and offers to walk the document over.

connections.description: FBI colleagues communicating about official business regarding a victim application.

events.title: Continued Presence Application Processing
events.description: An FBI agent submits an application for continued presence for one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, requiring a signature from another FBI personnel.

keyFacts: The FBI was processing a continued presence application for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2020.
The application required a signature from FBI personnel, indicating ongoing victim support efforts years after Epstein's death.
The email involves the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20), showing the case's classification.
The correspondence shows internal FBI procedures for handling victim-related applications.
